byline.original: By NATASHA SINGER and MIKE ISAAC

lead_paragraph: In collaboration with a charter school network, Facebook has developed a student-directed learning platform aimed at public schools.

headline.print_headline: Learning System Expands to Nearly 120 Schools
headline.main: Facebook Helps Develop Software That Puts Students in Charge of Their Lesson Plans

snippet: In collaboration with a charter school network, Facebook has developed a student-directed learning platform aimed at public schools....
abstract: Facebook and Summit Public Schools, nonprofit charter school system with headquarters in Silicon Valley, says almost 120 public schools will introduce free student-directed learning system in fall; Summit-Facebook system, called Summit Personalized Learning Platform, is in part attempt to build brand loyalty among students at early age.
